CatDescriptText: Mr. Cokey Sanders, truck driver, 502 Kirkpatrick Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 29, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that taverns should be permitted to remain open past midnight on Saturdays?" answer reads: "No, because it's the beginning of the Sabbath."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Cokey Sanders, wearing light colored zippered jacket and tweed cap, standing in front brick wall with public telephone, poster for Alaga syrup, and sign inscribed "...hip together this week committee...can Life, Inc. (Public Service Advertising Council)"
